DataElement.preferredName: Adrenocortical Carcinoma ENSAT Pathologic Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary adrenocortical carcinoma based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adrenal Cortex Carcinoma Pathologic ENSAT T Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival._A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival.

Concepts.definition: A rare, usually large (greater than 5cm), malignant epithelial tumor arising from the adrenal cortical cells.  Symptoms are usually related to the excessive production of hormones, and include Cushing's syndrome and virilism in women.  Common sites of metastasis include liver, lung, bone, and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  Advanced radiologic procedures have enabled the detection of small tumors, resulting in the improvement of the 5-year survival.

Property.preferredName: Pathologic ENSAT Staging Finding v7 T Stage
Property.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA Adrenocortical form and released per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 1/4/13

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pathologic Primary Tumor ENSAT T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Adrenal cancer with tumor size equal or less than 5.0 cm. There is no invasion of tissues outside the adrenal gland. (7th Ed, 2009)

Concepts.definition: Adrenal cancer with tumor size equal or less than 5.0 cm.  There is no invasion of tissues outside the adrenal gland. (7th Ed, 2009)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Adrenal cancer with tumor size more than 5.0 cm. There is no invasion of tissues outside the adrenal gland. (7th Ed, 2009)

Concepts.definition: Adrenal cancer with tumor size more than 5.0 cm. There is no invasion of tissues outside the adrenal gland. (7th Ed, 2009)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Adrenal cancer with tumor of any size. There is invasion of the fat that surrounds the adrenal gland. (7th Ed, 2009)

Concepts.definition: Adrenal cancer with tumor of any size.  There is invasion of the fat that surrounds the adrenal gland. (7th Ed, 2009)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Adrenal cancer with tumor of any size. There is invasion of nearby organs such as the kidney, pancreas, spleen or liver. (7th Ed, 2009)

Concepts.definition: Adrenal cancer with tumor of any size.  There is invasion of nearby organs such as the kidney, pancreas, spleen or liver. (7th Ed, 2009)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Concepts.longName: Pathologic Primary Tumor ENSAT Staging Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
